bibl.title: Basileia. Die Paläste der hellenistischen Könige. Internationales Symposion in Berlin vom 16.12.1992 bis 20.12.1992
bibl.note: The plan of Nea Paphos leads to consider the hill of Fanari as the most probable site of a palace in the Hellenistic period. Important architectural relics were discovered in rescue excavations by the Cypriote Department of Antiquities in 1958-1959.
bibl.seg: MLYNARCZYK Jolanta, Palaces of Strategoi and the Ptolemies in Nea Paphos. Topographical Remarks.

Wolfram HOEPFNER und Gunnar BRANDS (Hgg.), Basileia. Die Paläste der hellenistischen Könige. Internationales Symposion in Berlin vom 16.12.1992 bis 20.12.1992 (Mainz am Rhein, 1996) pp. 193-202, 2 figg., 5 plans.

The plan of Nea Paphos leads to consider the hill of Fanari as the most probable site of a palace in the Hellenistic period. Important architectural relics were discovered in rescue excavations by the Cypriote Department of Antiquities in 1958-1959.
